content:
"The Silent Patient" is a phenomenal book, and it's no surprise it's topping the charts. Alex Michaelides' writing is masterful, and the way he weaves the story together is just incredible. The twists and turns are expertly crafted to keep you guessing until the very end.

I'm glad to hear it kept you on the edge of your seat! That's exactly what a good psychological thriller should do. The Silent Patient has been a huge success, and it's been praised by readers and critics alike. It's also a great example of a debut novel that's made a huge impact in the literary world.

If you're looking for more books that will keep you on the edge of your seat, I'd be happy to recommend some other titles. Psychological thrillers are my specialty, and I've got a few more suggestions up my sleeve.

In the meantime, what did you think of the ending of "The Silent Patient"? Did you see the twist coming, or did it catch you off guard?
